alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Northern Worcester; Western Franklin (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 6:13PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Worcester and northeastern Franklin Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 612 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Greenfield, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Little to no impact from hail is expected. Locations impacted include... Greenfield, Deerfield, Montague, Sunderland, Northfield, Bernardston, Shelburne, Leverett, Erving, Colrain, Gill, Royalston, Wendell, Warwick and Leyden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for western Massachusetts. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for central Massachusetts.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Franklin; Northern Worcester; Western Franklin
